author: Kristina O’Neill
title: WSJ. Magazine Editor’s Letter: Higher Ground
text:
SOME CALL IT getting “Oprah’d.” When people encounter the legendary talk-show host, network chief, actress, philanthropist and self-made billionaire in person, a common reaction to the emotional significance of the moment is to burst into tears. As you’ll discover in this issue’s cover story, it happened to Reese Witherspoon, Oprah’s co-star in the new film A Wrinkle in Time, when she visited her at home in California. And I’ll admit, without a hint of embarrassment, that when I showed up on the set of Oprah’s cover shoot, it happened to me, too: The minute I caught sight of her, my eyes started pooling with tears.
...
